title: Ethical Animal Utilization Simulation Training for Veterinary Education: A Mathematical Modeling-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced veterinary theory, advanced applied techniques, and foundational mathematical modeling (probability, optimization, statistics)
context.additional_context: Practical training for veterinary company managers/leaders on implementing mathematical decision-making models when introducing alternatives to animal testing.

learning_goals: Development of optimal path calculation skills considering probabilistic variables in surgical procedures for animal models (horses, cattle, poultry, etc.) in VR simulations.
Quantification of animal use protocols by implementing AAVC ethics guidelines into a mathematical evaluation model (e.g., weighted scoring system).
Presentation of three or more criteria applying mathematical optimization (cost-effectiveness analysis, accuracy prediction, etc.) when selecting alternative techniques for training purposes.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
